ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨ Adding new colour palettes

Youâ€™d like to add a new palette based on your favourite recordâ€™s artwork? Great! Hereâ€™s how:

  1. Find an image of your record e.g.Â on bandcamp.com and copy the image URL.
  2. Open it on coolors.co by selecting â€œBrowse imageâ€ and pasting the image URL.
  3. Decide if youâ€™re making a qualitative, sequential or diverging colour palette - some images are better suited to one palette type vs.Â another!
  4. Create your masterpiece by selecting 6 colours from the image! You can also manually adjust the colours by exporting the palette (select â€œExport paletteâ€, and â€œOpen in the generatorâ€).
  5. Once youâ€™ve finalised the colours, open an issue with the title â€œNew palette: <your_palette_nameâ€, and include the following information:
    • Palette name: one word based on the name of your record.
    • Colours: the 6 hex codes of your colour palette.
    • Palette URL: a URL to the palette in coolors: from the image picker, select â€œExport paletteâ€, and â€œOpen in the generatorâ€.
    • Palette metadata: the artist, record and track name.
    • Record URL: a URL to bandcamp (or other) where people can also enjoy the record.
  6. Thatâ€™s it! Iâ€™ll add the palette to the package as soon as I can. Thank you!

âœï¸ Fixing typos

If you spot a typo in the package documentation, you can fix it in the source file. The package uses roxygen to automatically build the .Rd files (documentation), so please donâ€™t edit these directly!

ğŸ› Reporting bugs

If something isnâ€™t working as it should, please open an issue! Please try to include a reprex with a minimal amount of code to reproduce the bug.

ğŸ’­ Anything else

If you have ideas for bigger changes, start by opening an issue and we can chat about if and how to move forward!
